title: Podolsky District
text:
Podolsky District () is an abolished administrative and municipal district (<a href="raion">raion</a>), one of the <a href="administrative%20divisions%20of%20Moscow%20Oblast">thirty-six</a> in <a href="Moscow%20Oblast">Moscow Oblast</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. It was located in the southwest of the <a href="oblast">oblast</a> just south of the <a href="federal%20cities%20of%20Russia">federal city</a> of <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>. The area of the district was . It was <a href="administrative%20center">administrative center</a> the <a href="types%20of%20inhabited%20localities%20in%20Russia">city</a> of <a href="Podolsk">Podolsk</a> (which is not administratively a part of the district).
History.
A part of Podolsky District was merged into the federal city of Moscow on July 1, 2012. In 2015, the district has been abolished, its territory, with the city of Podolsk, was included in the and <a href="Podolsk%20Urban%20Okrug">Podolsk Urban Okrug</a>.
